intro: Weinmannia rarotongensis, commonly known as the Cook Islands tree, is a flowering plant native to the Cook Islands. It belongs to the family Cupressaceae, which includes cypress and related coniferous trees. The plant is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and distinctive, clustered inflorescences. It typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to the humid, tropical climate of its native habitat. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
